metadata.title: CVE-2019-2053 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - negligible
metadata.description:
In wnm_parse_neighbor_report_elem of wnm_sta.c, there is a possibleout-of-bounds read due to missing bounds check. This could lead to localinformation disclosure with no additional execution privileges needed. Userinteraction is not needed for exploitation. Product: Android Versions:Android-7.0 Android-7.1.1 Android-7.1.2 Android-8.0 Android-8.1 Android-9Android ID: A-122074159

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2053` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 2.9-1ubuntu4
wpagui - 2.9-1ubuntu4
wpasupplicant - 2.9-1ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9-1ubuntu4').
